alert.note: Alert for Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Dickenson. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Many road closures are ongoing. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated stream gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - -Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. -Many roads across the county are experiencing damage from flooding. -Runoff will continue to cause strong stream flows and river rises. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clintwood and John Flannagan Lake and the Pound River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely or report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
